issue.title: [turbopack] TypeError: The "path" argument must be of type string. Received undefined

labels.name: bug/1-unconfirmed
labels.description: Bug should have enough information for reproduction, but confirmation has not happened yet.

repository.name: prisma
repository.description: Next-generation ORM for Node.js & TypeScript | PostgreSQL, MySQL, MariaDB, SQL Server, SQLite, MongoDB and CockroachDB

issue.body:
### Bug description

This error occurs when:
- using `next@15.2.0-canary.40` or above (works on `15.2.0-canary.39` and below)
- using `next dev --turbopack` (works with `next dev` or `next build` which uses webpack)
- using custom `output` path in the generator block of `schema.prisma`

Not sure if it's a prisma or turbopack issue?

### How to reproduce

1. Clone https://github.com/DiPSoMaNiE/next-canary-prisma-issue
2. Run `bun install`
3. Run `prisma generate`
4. Run `bun dev`
5. Go to `http://localhost:3000` and see error

To make it work:
1. Comment the `output   = "../generated"` line in `prisma/schema.prisma`
2. Run `prisma generate`
3. Change `import { PrismaClient } from '../generated'` to `import { PrismaClient } from '@prisma/client'` in `src/db.ts`
4. Run `bun dev`
5. Go to `http://localhost:3000` and see it works

### Expected behavior

Everything should work as expected with a custom output path for the generated PrismaClient.

### Prisma information

`prisma/schema.prisma`
```prisma
datasource db {
  provider = "postgresql"
  url      = env("DATABASE_URL")
}

generator client {
  provider = "prisma-client-js"
  output   = "../generated"
}

model User {
  id        String   @id @default(cuid(2))
  name      String
  email     String   @unique
  createdAt DateTime @default(now())
  updatedAt DateTime @updatedAt
}
```

`src/db.ts`
```ts
import { PrismaClient } from '../generated'

declare const globalThis: typeof global & { db: PrismaClient }

export const db = globalThis.db ?? new PrismaClient()

if (process.env.NODE_ENV !== 'production') globalThis.db = db
```

`src/app/page.tsx`
```tsx
import { db } from '@/db'

export default async function Home() {
  console.log('count', await db.user.count())

  return <>...</>
}
```

### Environment & setup

- OS: macOS Sequoia 15.3.1
- Database: PostgreSQL 17
- Node.js version: 22.14.0


### Prisma Version

```
prisma                  : 6.4.1
@prisma/client          : 6.4.1
Computed binaryTarget   : darwin-arm64
Operating System        : darwin
Architecture            : arm64
Node.js                 : v22.14.0
TypeScript              : 5.7.3
Query Engine (Node-API) : libquery-engine a9055b89e58b4b5bfb59600785423b1db3d0e75d (at node_modules/@prisma/engines/libquery_engine-darwin-arm64.dylib.node)
Schema Engine           : schema-engine-cli a9055b89e58b4b5bfb59600785423b1db3d0e75d (at node_modules/@prisma/engines/schema-engine-darwin-arm64)
Schema Wasm             : @prisma/prisma-schema-wasm 6.4.0-29.a9055b89e58b4b5bfb59600785423b1db3d0e75d
Default Engines Hash    : a9055b89e58b4b5bfb59600785423b1db3d0e75d
Studio                  : 0.509.0
```

body: Same error here. I can confirm that it works when downgrading to `next@15.1.7`.
We got the same error, using turborepo and export the db as package, same as @davecarlson

Can confirm this is an issue

_Edit by maintainer bot: Comment was **automatically** minimized because it was considered unhelpful. (If you think this was by mistake, let us know). Please only comment if it adds context to the issue. If you want to express that you have the same problem, use the upvote ðŸ‘ on the issue description or subscribe to the issue for updates. Thanks!_

> We got the same error, using turborepo and export the db as package, same as [@davecarlson](https://github.com/davecarlson)

Did not mention it but I also have the database as a package within a monorepo using Turborepo, which is why I use a custom output path to manage multiple database packages. However, I have simplified the reproduction case as it is not directly related to the issue.

If you are only working with a single database in your monorepo, a quick workaround would be to avoid using a custom output path for the generated `PrismaClient` and instead re-export it from `@prisma/client`.
related to this issue as well. https://github.com/boxyhq/jackson/issues/3657#issue-2883690682

I'm also encountering this error when trying to import `@google-cloud/pubsub`:

```js
import { PubSub } from "@google-cloud/pubsub"
```

The issue seems to be that `__dirname` is `undefined` when using Turbopack. I tested this in a Server Component with the following code:

```js
console.log("__dirname", __dirname)
```

With Webpack, the directory containing the file is correctly printed. However, when using Turbopack, `__dirname` is `undefined`.

```txt
__dirname undefined
```

issue.title: Turbopack(canary) - TypeError: The "path" argument must be of type string. Received undefined
issue.body:
### Link to the code that reproduces this issue

https://codesandbox.io/p/sandbox/github/vercel/next.js/tree/canary/examples/reproduction-template

### To Reproduce

1. set up nextjs on canary version (v > 15.1.1-canary.19)
2. enable turbopack
3. use `@google-analytics/data` 's `new BetaAnalyticsDataClient()`
4. wonder wtf is that "path" error?

### Current vs. Expected behavior

when turbopack is disabled it works perfectly, no errors nothing,

if it enabled it throws this:
```
TypeError: The "path" argument must be of type string. Received undefined.
{stack trace}
```


### Provide environment information

```bash
Operating System:
  Platform: win32
  Arch: x64      
  Version: Windows 10 Pro
  Available memory (MB): 32717
  Available CPU cores: 16
Binaries:
  Node: 22.8.0
  npm: 10.9.0
  Yarn: N/A
  pnpm: 9.5.0
Relevant Packages:
  next: 15.2.1-canary.1 
  eslint-config-next: 15.1.2
  react: 19.0.0
  react-dom: 19.0.0
  typescript: 5.7.3
Next.js Config:
  output: standalone
```

### Which area(s) are affected? (Select all that apply)

Turbopack

### Which stage(s) are affected? (Select all that apply)

next dev (local)

### Additional context

i didnt fully checked, but in version `15.1.1-canary.19` it works while `15.2.0-canary.71` it doesnt

body:
I also got the same error after trying to upgrade to Nextjs 15.2. Using turborepo and prisma as a package

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/5674abf1-a443-4551-9b59-a852208acf3b)
same issue after upgrading to 15.2, prisma as a separate package in monorepo with custom output path

seeing same thing after 15.2 upgrade with `import { SecretManagerServiceClient } from '@google-cloud/secret-manager';`, seeing this error: `TypeError: The "path" argument must be of type string. Received undefined`

EDIT: running `next dev` works, and `next dev --turbo` does not

> seeing same thing after 15.2 upgrade with `import { SecretManagerServiceClient } from '@google-cloud/secret-manager';`, seeing this error: `TypeError: The "path" argument must be of type string. Received undefined`
> 
> EDIT: running `next dev` works, and `next dev --turbo` does not

removing the turbo flag works. makes you appreciate how quick the thing is :(
